channel.title: Basic C
channel.description: can anybody give me a couple of good tut's or w/e to learn C?

item.title: Basic C
item.dc:creator: @PeeHPee PeeHPee
item.description:
@PeeHPee wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:13, topic:341781”][quote author=PeeHPee link=topic=438179.msg3220397#msg3220397 date=1275136653]

Learn C++ [size=44pt]instead[/size]. www.cplusplus.com

umm are you fucking stupid? he asked for resources on learning C, not C++.

anyway, i got this from the section sticky: http://www.physics.drexel.edu/courses/Comp_Phys/General/C_basics/c_tutorial.html.
[/quote]
There, larger for you.[/quote]

pure2ownage:

can anybody give me a couple of good tut’s or w/e to learn [size=44pt]C[/size]?

there, larger for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic C
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:11, topic:341781”]WRONG

if youre gonna learn C, learn C
if youre gonna learn C++, learn C++

im sure everyone is sick of seeing C++ written by a c programmer[/quote]
absolutely, that is why its better to learn c++, then learn c after. you cant use c++ practices in c at all, so you’re forced to learn c concepts after you learn c++ concepts. the other way around, you can use all c concepts in c++, so you can easily do stupid crap.

also some things can only be done with c in c++, so you’d have to learn those things… (you cant just learn c++, nomsain)

Read full topic

item.title: Basic C
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:14, topic:341781”]Just because people said C and C++, what about C# :D[/quote]C# isn’t even remotely similar to C; people were suggesting C++ because it’s very similar to C , just with more focus on object orientation rather than procedural orientation and with easier dynamic memory management.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic C
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“PeeHPee, post:8, topic:341781”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=438179.msg3220523#msg3220523 date=1275144716]

Learn C++ instead. www.cplusplus.com

umm are you fucking stupid? he asked for resources on learning C, not C++.

But if you know C++ you’ll know all the basics of C so theres no problem with doing that. Plus, you learn more concepts of object orientated programming that the op may have not come across in java. There are a considerable number of idiots that just write C code and compile it as C++.
[/quote]

…

you need to know the basics of C to begin even writing C++ code.[/quote]
WRONG
much better to learn c++ first, google it if curious

Read full topic
